poem:
**Endorsement at Dawn**

In the city where shadows mingle with ambition,  
Hakeem leans in, a whisper against the brick skyline,  
and Zohran, a figure rising from campaign fatigue,  
finds his name wrapped in the folds of morning paper.  
Reporters dot the landscape like sparrows,  
their questions scattering in the wind,  
as democracy lifts its sleepy head toward the light.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hakeem Jeffries endorses Zohran Mamdani for New York City mayor The House minority leader, Hakeem Jeffries, endorsed Zohran Mamdani for New York City mayor on Friday, ending a four-month standoff that left the Democratic nominee without the backing of one of the party’s most powerful figures until the day before early voting begins. The announcement arrives after months of pressure from progressives in Congress and after the top Democrat has been repeatedly grilled by reporters". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Hakeem Jeffries endorses Zohran Mamdani for New York City mayor The House minority leader, Hakeem Jeffries, endorsed Zohran Mamdani for New York City mayor on Friday, ending a four-month standoff that left the Democratic nominee without the backing of one of the party’s most powerful figures until the day before early voting begins. The announcement arrives after months of pressure from progressives in Congress and after the top Democrat has been repeatedly grilled by reporters
